result.markdown:
---
title: "Anova Fatorial"
author: "Nívia"
format: html
---


# ANOVA - 2 ou mais fatores

Quando se tem dois fatores ou mais, não se tem a opção de usar teste não paramétrico (Kruskal). A função aov() em 1 fator é apenas variável resposta em função do tratamento (resposta \~ tratamento), mas com 2 ou mais o aov() é a resposta \~ do tratamento1\*tratamento2 (ex.: resposta em função do fator 1 versus o fator2).

**Preparo pré-análise**:


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_15ffbd8a26a70d028337e5bf552b5966'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
```
:::


Banco de dados utilizado: fungicida-vaso (conjunto de dados do dados diversos). Objeto nomeado como dat.


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_cf1ecca99063542b6673dbc5a1e1c8fb'}

```{.r .cell-code}
dat <- read_excel("dados-diversos.xlsx", "fungicida_vaso")
```
:::


Calculo da % do número de espigas com doença. Cria uma nova coluna:


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_be001708ccea79d932fb41dad1f3a2d7'}

```{.r .cell-code}
dat2 <- dat |>
  mutate(inc = dis_sp / n_sp*100)

dat2 |>
  ggplot(aes(x = treat,
             y = inc))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.1)+
  facet_wrap(~dose)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula11_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Gera modelo de anova: trata como dados qualitativos.


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_e6c8fe0c78d912145b2c2323da4a6948'}

```{.r .cell-code}
m1 <- aov(inc ~treat*dose, 
          dat = dat2)
summary(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)    
treat        1  919.5   919.5   24.31 0.000151 ***
dose         1  920.9   920.9   24.34 0.000150 ***
treat:dose   1  747.7   747.7   19.76 0.000407 ***
Residuals   16  605.3    37.8                     
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::


Checa as premissas e visualiza com DHARMa:


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_b3ff7b7c47c3e09184e2ae88095bc0f6'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(performance)
check_normality(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Non-normality of residuals detected (p = 0.018).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Heteroscedasticity (non-constant error variance) detected (p < .001).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(DHARMa)
plot(simulateResiduals(m1))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula11_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Como está se trabalhando com dados de percentagem,tenta transformar os dados com log. Embora a normalidade pareça anormal, a homogeneidade é mais importante.


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_ba51cfaf7fa4ee17f4435f8e0280f76c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
m1 <- aov(log(inc + 0.5) ~ treat*dose, 
          dat = dat2)
summary(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value  Pr(>F)   
treat        1 12.928  12.928  13.980 0.00179 **
dose         1  5.663   5.663   6.124 0.02491 * 
treat:dose   1  5.668   5.668   6.129 0.02486 * 
Residuals   16 14.796   0.925                   
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Non-normality of residuals detected (p = 0.050).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.180).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(simulateResiduals(m1))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula11_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Estimando a média dos tratamentos para cada interação: primeiro os tratamentos dentro das doses e depois as dose dentro dos tratamentos.


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_8944d595524fbc9aabc398eddc1325c1'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(emmeans)
means_m1 <- emmeans(m1, ~ treat | dose,
                    type = "response")
means_m1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
dose = 0.5:
 treat        response     SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 Ionic liquid    27.05 11.847 16   10.570    68.05
 Tebuconazole     1.21  0.737 16    0.188     3.76

dose = 2.0:
 treat        response     SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 Ionic liquid     3.10  1.412 16    1.065     7.77
 Tebuconazole     1.42  0.925 16    0.194     4.83

Confidence level used: 0.95 
Intervals are back-transformed from the log(mu + 0.5) scale 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(multcompView)
library(multcomp)
cld(means_m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
dose = 0.5:
 treat        response     SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
 Tebuconazole     1.21  0.737 16    0.188     3.76  1    
 Ionic liquid    27.05 11.847 16   10.570    68.05   2   

dose = 2.0:
 treat        response     SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
 Tebuconazole     1.42  0.925 16    0.194     4.83  1    
 Ionic liquid     3.10  1.412 16    1.065     7.77  1    

Confidence level used: 0.95 
Intervals are back-transformed from the log(mu + 0.5) scale 
Tests are performed on the log scale 
significance level used: alpha = 0.05 
NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol,
      then we cannot show them to be different.
      But we also did not show them to be the same. 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#dose dentro dos tratamentos 
#means_ml <- emmeans(ml1, ~ dose | trat, type = "response")
```
:::


Vendo o coeficiente de variação:


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_653e6c76fdc9cab627b86d66e4bebbcb'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(agricolae)
cv.model(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 65.04818
```
:::
:::


## ANOVA com 3 fatores

Dados sobre a interação entre tipo de armazenamento e umidade.


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_519162fd5a835445e6af10017fc5137d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
milho <- read_excel("dados-diversos.xlsx", "armazena")
milho |>
  filter(tempo ==8) |>
  ggplot(aes(factor(tipo), peso_mil,
             color = factor(umidade)))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.1)+
  facet_wrap(~ umidade)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula11_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Testar a interação entre o tipo de armazenamento e o tempo 8:


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_bd0b38ef6fe055333d23e15510fe923a'}

```{.r .cell-code}
milho2 <- milho |>
  filter(tempo ==8)

m2 <- aov(peso_mil ~ factor(tipo)*factor(umidade),
          data = milho2)
summary(m2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
                             Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)    
factor(tipo)                  1  11215   11215  2375.8 3.64e-15 ***
factor(umidade)               2  42814   21407  4534.8  < 2e-16 ***
factor(tipo):factor(umidade)  2   2329    1165   246.7 1.79e-10 ***
Residuals                    12     57       5                     
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::


testanto tipo de inoculação na incidencia de fusarium em milho


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_2137c834dca0470c42ec9b2b1e4f375d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
milho3 <- read_excel("dados-diversos.xlsx", "milho")

m4 <- aov(yield ~hybrid*method,
          data = milho3)
summary(m4)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
              Df    Sum Sq  Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)    
hybrid         5 105876446 21175289   8.312 2.66e-05 ***
method         1     42951    42951   0.017    0.897    
hybrid:method  5  10619453  2123891   0.834    0.534    
Residuals     36  91709593  2547489                     
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(m4)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.928).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(simulateResiduals(m4))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula11_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
medias_m4 <- emmeans(m4, ~ hybrid)
medias_m4
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 hybrid   emmean  SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 30F53 HX  10598 564 36     9453    11742
 30F53 YH   9309 564 36     8165    10454
 30K64     11018 564 36     9874    12162
 30S31H     8652 564 36     7507     9796
 30S31YH    8056 564 36     6912     9201
 BG7049H   12402 564 36    11257    13546

Results are averaged over the levels of: method 
Confidence level used: 0.95 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cld(medias_m4)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 hybrid   emmean  SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
 30S31YH    8056 564 36     6912     9201  1    
 30S31H     8652 564 36     7507     9796  12   
 30F53 YH   9309 564 36     8165    10454  12   
 30F53 HX  10598 564 36     9453    11742   23  
 30K64     11018 564 36     9874    12162   23  
 BG7049H   12402 564 36    11257    13546    3  

Results are averaged over the levels of: method 
Confidence level used: 0.95 
P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 6 estimates 
significance level used: alpha = 0.05 
NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol,
      then we cannot show them to be different.
      But we also did not show them to be the same. 
```
:::
:::


Caso a interação não dê sifnificativa, tira a interação e deixa só o fator que teve significancia (isola o fator).


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_d586b1a86b8356a02ff05ca91a1b8a47'}

```{.r .cell-code}
m5 <- aov(yield ~hybrid, data = milho3)
summary(m5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Df    Sum Sq  Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)    
hybrid       5 105876446 21175289   8.688 1.02e-05 ***
Residuals   42 102371996  2437428                     
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
m4 <- aov(yield ~hybrid,
          data = milho3)
summary(m5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Df    Sum Sq  Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)    
hybrid       5 105876446 21175289   8.688 1.02e-05 ***
Residuals   42 102371996  2437428                     
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(m5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.763).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(simulateResiduals(m5))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula11_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
medias_m5 <- emmeans(m5, ~hybrid)
medias_m5
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 hybrid   emmean  SE df lower.CL upper.CL
 30F53 HX  10598 552 42     9484    11712
 30F53 YH   9309 552 42     8195    10423
 30K64     11018 552 42     9904    12132
 30S31H     8652 552 42     7538     9765
 30S31YH    8056 552 42     6942     9170

Confidence level used: 0.95 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cld(medias_m5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

 30S31YH    8056 552 42     6942     9170  1

```

```
         30F53 HX 30F53 YH   30K64  30S31H 30S31YH BG7049H
```

:::


# Dados não paramétricos com 2 ou mais fatores - Rank

Para dados com um fator, pode-se usar as 3 alternativas citadas na aula 10. Quando se tem 2 fatores, pode-se analisar cada fator separadamente, mas para testar a interação usa-se outra alternativa, o ranck.


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_46155d40a03adf20ec6706b47846b2d5'}

```{.r .cell-code}
fung <- read_excel("dados-diversos.xlsx", "fungicida_vaso")
fung2 <- fung |>
  mutate(inc = inf_seeds/n_seeds*100,
         rank_inc = rank(inc))
rank_anova <- aov(rank_inc ~treat*dose, data = fung2)
summary(rank_anova)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value  Pr(>F)   
treat        1 220.00  220.00  14.204 0.00168 **
dose         1 105.34  105.34   6.801 0.01904 * 
treat:dose   1  80.34   80.34   5.187 0.03684 * 
Residuals   16 247.82   15.49                   
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::


**Médias do rank**: Depois usa o emmeans para ver as médias com o rank.


::: {.cell hash='Aula11_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-14_233b16a7f6a95f97bf4ee335fc58844a'}

```{.r .cell-code}
means_rank <- emmeans(rank_anova, ~treat | dose)
cld(means_rank)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
dose = 0.5:
 treat        emmean   SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
 Tebuconazole   6.90 1.76 16     3.17     10.6  1    
 Ionic liquid  18.00 1.76 16    14.27     21.7   2   

dose = 2.0:
 treat        emmean   SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
 Tebuconazole   6.75 1.97 16     2.58     10.9  1    
 Ionic liquid   9.75 1.61 16     6.34     13.2  1    

Confidence level used: 0.95 
significance level used: alpha = 0.05 
NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol,
      then we cannot show them to be different.
      But we also did not show them to be the same. 
```
:::
:::


Na tabela coloca os dados originais com os dados rankeados.
